4.name: Google
4.notes: EBIT, Capex and Total debt were picked from 10-k fillings, other data from TIKR.
4.summary:
For the 6 months ended 30 June
Revenues +17-18%
Net income -11%
Main difference is Other income, debt and equity securities which was +7.4B for 2021 and -1.6B 2022 without taking into account this difference, it would be +11%

For the quarter ended 30 September
Revenues +6% (+11% on a constant currency basis)
Net income -27% Increased total costs and expenses by 8k and Other income went from +2 to -1

10.guidance:
From press releases: Stock repurchase of 250M$

From Q2 earnings presentation
Organic growth 13,9%, growth of 75% net revenue
Gross margin 26,6%
Guidance 2022
- net revenue 6.4-6.5
- adjusted EBITDA 650-675
- net debt in Q2 2022 / adjusted EBITDA is 3.9x, end of 2023 target is 2.5x

Guidance from Q3 earnings presentation
Expected 10% organic growth for Q4
- net revenue 6.4-6.5
- adjusted EBITDA 650-675
- Adjusted free cash flow 372 to 392
- net debt in Q3 2022 / adjusted EBITDA is 3.6x, end of 2023 target is 2.0x - 2.5x

2022 EBITDA is adjusted one from guidance

from last presentations in 2022: Guidance 2025
- Service and monitoring representing 60%+ of total net revenues
- EBITDA margin to 13% by 2025
- Adjusted free cash flow conversion of ~80%
- Net Debt/EBITDA leverage to 2.0-2.5x

13.name: Nagarro
13.notes:
2022
Total debt is Non-current liabilities from Q3 report so far

Conservative scenario
Potential recession on 2023
- Nagarro says target (morosidad) is 1% but looking at a recession scenario of competitors, like EPAM 2011 10-k, from trade receivables, allowance for doubtful accounts:
  - 2009 (severe recession): Accounts receivable was 27450 and allowance was 3246 so ~12%
  - 2010 (softer recession): Accounts receivable was 41488 and allowance 1671 so ~4%
- So, provision for bad debt could be 5% from Trade receivables + contract assets, around 10M, can be added to operating expenses
13.thesis:
- What is the company's business?
- How does the company earn money?
- How is growth? Organic, M&A?
- How is the market is operating within? Grows? Which countries operates in?
- ROE & ROIC
- Competitive advantage
- Risks
  - Potential recession on 2023
    - Nagarro says target (morosidad) is 1% but looking at a recession scenario of competitors, like EPAM 2011 10-k, from trade receivables, allowance for doubtful accounts:
      - 2009 (severe recession): Accounts receivable was 27450 and allowance was 3246 so ~12%
      - 2010 (softer recession): Accounts receivable was 41488 and allowance 1671 so ~4%
    - So, provision for bad debt could be 5% from Trade receivables + contract assets, around 10M
- Insiders & managers
- How does it behave in crisis periods?
- Competitors & Comparables
- Why are the stocks cheap?

16.name: Amazon
16.notes:
Third Quarter 2022 Guidance
 Net sales are expected to be between $125.0 billion and $130.0 billion, or to grow between 13% and 17% compared
with third quarter 2021. This guidance anticipates an unfavorable impact of approximately 390 basis points from
foreign exchange rates.
 Operating income is expected to be between $0 and $3.5 billion, compared with $4.9 billion in third quarter 2021.
 This guidance assumes, among other things, that no additional business acquisitions, restructurings, or legal
settlements are concluded.

2023 Q1 Guidance for FY 2023

Adjusted earnings per share range of $7.30 - $7.80, 8% expected mid-point growth versus comparable prior year

EBITDA growth 4-6%
Grow annual dividend
EPS growth 7-12%
TSR (Total share holder) growth 10-15%

-Mlv4sC_meTa7Srk7iRF.name: Claranova
-Mlv4sC_meTa7Srk7iRF.notes:
- Valuation:
3 possible scenarios
1 -> Optimistic: 700M revenue, 10% EBITDA margin, P/FCF 18x, EV/EBITDA 11x
2 -> Normal: 600M revenue, 8% EBITDA margin, P/FCF 15x, EV/EBITDA 9x
3 -> Conservative: 500M revenue, 6% EBITDA margin, P/FCF 13x, EV/EBITDA 7x.
-Mlv4sC_meTa7Srk7iRF.summary:
Summary:
2022 Half 1 seems to have almost no growth, 1% but also because of special market conditions, exiting pandemic measures, Apple iOS 14.5, supply chain pressures, Russia invasion in Ukraine... wait for future news.
For the moment let's say is the conservative scenario.

Guidance
The lower growth in H1 is expected to delay achievement of the 700m
revenue target and on that basis Claranova now expects to reach this
milestone at the end of FY 2023-2024
The Group is nevertheless maintaining its EBITDA margin target of 10% for
FY 2022-2023

NOTES:
-Interests expense from income(2021): Taken from annual report, Note 13, just included borrowing costs not foreing exchange losses or IFRS 16 expenses.
-Capex(2021): Included acquisition of intangible and property plant and equipment.
-Mlv4sC_meTa7Srk7iRF.thesis:
- What is the company's business?
Internet, mobile, IoT in USA. 3 parts:
The PlanetArt segment offers FreePrints Photobooks, tiles, cards for greeting...
Avanquest provides antivirus, ad blocker, cleaning, signPdf.
Mydevices offers application platform that provides a range of IoT solutions.

- How does the company earn money?
Forecast of revenues 2021 -> planetart 380 Avanquest 88 myDevices 1

Avanquest went from 50 to 78% recurring revenues as subscription, means EBITDA decreases but CFO increases due to deferred revenues.
Normal revenues for instance buy license -> 100$ 1st year
Recurring revenues as subscription -> 30 1st year, 60 2nd, 90, 120... So from the 4th year is more money, before that point is not.

- How is growth? Organic, M&A?
Sales growth was bad in the past, nowadays very high and estimated future not so good, why?
Different strategy based on M&A growth that led to financial problems. Management team has renewed and has different strategy.
20% organic growth, 32% M&A.

Also has the objective of having 700M revenue and 10% EBITDA by 2023.

- How is the market is operating within? Grows? Which countries operates in?
Online Photo Printing Market size worth $ 21,082.23 Million, Globally, by 2028 at 6.47% CAGR
https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2021/10/12/2312779/0/en/Online-Photo-Printing-Market-size-worth-21-082-23-Million-Globally-by-2028-at-6-47-CAGR-Verified-Market-Research.html
Revenue by country:
USA 59%
UK 18%
France 6%
Germany 4%
Other european countries 8%
Rest of the world 5%

- Competitive advantage
Scale, company uses local manufacturers for photo printing, as they increase the amount of workload can obtain better prices from them.
Change cost, customers get so used to the app, which is so good, rating of 4,7 or 4,8 in play store, that keep using this one instead of downloading another one.
Management team is very good.

- Risks
Benefited by covid, how much??
Complex historic, turnaround from 2013.
Small cap, unknown company.
M&A strategy.

- How does it behave in crisis?
We can check CEWE, is an european competitor, operating income didn't decrease during 2008 crisis.
CIMPRESS is another competitor, had a nice increase during 2008 crisis.
Shutterfly is a competitor of the photographs part, which is like 60% of CLA, had a huge increase in crisis.
Does Covid impact? People when covid started, at home started printing a lot of photos, afterwards, as no trips, or events were having place, decreased.

- Comparables (check for ratios)
ODDO report does a good analysis:
Avanquest part - Market peers -> Avast, KApe technologies
PlanetArt part - Market peers -> Shutterfly, CEWE

- Insiders & managers
CEOs salary is around 800k, in France with taxes equals to 400k, but has like 20M in stocks of the company, so it is totally aligned.

- If they are, why the stocks are cheap?
Small company, 200M.
Profit is still very low, thesis is the outlook provided by the company, having 700M revenue and 70M EBITDA by 2023.

-MmsiI-nK65fD8JGAlrI.name: Nomad Foods

Summary
Nomad foods is a SPAC
TODO: Rest of summary
-MmsiI-nK65fD8JGAlrI.thesis:
- What is the company's business?
Frozen food. Has got many high awareness brands and a new brand called Green Cuisine which is having a great growth since launched in 2019.

- How does the company earn money?


- How is growth? Organic, M&A?
Guidance for 2022 is growing at a similar rate than in 2021, 3-5% revenue, adjusted EPS 1.5 to 1.55 -> 11-15% growth. Organic growth of 1-2%, this guidance does not include acquisition of Fortenova, expected to close 3rd quarter 2021.

2025 Long term financial targets
3000M+ revenues
600M+ EBITDA
1500M+ Cumulative FCF
2.3 Adj EPS

2020 1.14 EPS to 2025 2.3 EPS -> 15% CAGR

- Fortenova's acquisition
615M -> 10x Adjusted EBITDA
2021 revenue of 279M Adjusted EBITDA 53M
Combined Adjusted EPS 2021 $2.00 -> 1.69 per share
Oportunity to grow Adjusted EBITDA by 50%
6-9% accretive to Adjusted EPS in year 1 before synergies

- How is the market is operating within? Grows? Which countries operates in?
Mostly UK, Italy and Germany. But also in Sweden, France, Norway, Austria, Spain and rest of Europe.
Had a huge growth since COVID although keeps growing but at a smaller rate
Online growth increased from 10-15% to ~70 YoY.

- ROE & ROIC

- Competitive advantage
Products known, high brand awareness, good penetration, very good for green cuisine, healthy products.
Third largest branded frozen food company in the world, undisputed leader in Europe, 2nd one has half share.
Management team.
Good M&A strategy.

- Risks
Raw materials & supply chain
M&A
Small organic growth can lead to lower ratios


- Insiders & managers
CEO has got a salary of 700k and stocks for 90M so totally aligned

- How does it behave in crisis periods?
Checking Nestle and Conagra behaviour revenues went a bit down not a lot, valuation decreased but got recovered in a year or so.

- Competitors & comparables
Nestle 1st in world 3rd Europe none or small growth
  EV/EBITDA -> 18-20
  EV/EBIT -> 20-24
  PER -> 21-26
Conagra, 2nd in world small growth
  EV/EBITDA -> 10-11
  EV/EBIT -> 12-14
  PER -> 12-15
Dr Oetker 2nd in Europe
MCCain 4th World 4th Europe

- Scenarios
Optimistic 13% EPS growth P/FCF 20, EV/EBITDA 13
Normal 10% EPS growth, P/FCF 18, EV/EBITDA 12
Conservative 6% EPS growth, P/FCF 16, EV/EBITDA 11, decrease debt, repurchase stocks.

- Why are the stocks cheap?
Boring market
Bad perception of debt 2,5x

-NDdmqYS55o4cx9UnseF.thesis:
Based in Canada, provide software solutions for other companies. UX/UI design, Cloud solutions, content moderation, computer vision, machine learning.
Has presence in north America, Europe and East Asia.
About 70000 employees.

- How does the company earn money? - Pending analysis
Technology & games 46%
Communication & Media 23%
eCommerce & Fintech 12%
Banking, Financial Services & Insurance 8%
Customers in North America make 88% of revenue.

About 17% of the growth is organic.

Operating in Software consulting market which grows at 10.9% per year according to https://www.grandviewresearch.com/industry-analysis/software-consulting-market.

Potential market of 225B.

-NG7bNy29IeAIUFEfLOT.guidance:

TPV grow ~12%, ~16% FXN
Net revenues $27.85 billion, ~10%, ~11% FXN excluding eBay ~13.5%, ~14.5% FXN
GAAP EPS ~$1.52-$1.62 ($3.52 in FY21), non-GAAP EPS ~$3.87-$3.97 ($4.60 in FY21).

Q3 guidance FY'22
TPV grow ~8.5%, ~12.5% FXN
Net revenues ~$27.5 billion, ~8.5%, ~10% FXN, excluding eBay ~12%, ~13% FXN
GAAP EPS ~$2.11-$2.13 ($3.52 in FY21), non-GAAP EPS ~$4.07-$4.09 ($4.60 in FY21).

-NIlM-6RjFAWBZ6mZEmL.name: Playway
-NIlM-6RjFAWBZ6mZEmL.thesis:
- What is the company's business?
  - PlayWay S.A. produces and publishes PC and mobile video games in Poland, Western Europe, North America, Germany, and internationally. It sells its products through STEAM, AppStore, GooglePlay, PS Store and xBox store platforms. The company was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Warsaw, Poland.
- How does the company earn money?
  - Selling video games in distributors like Steam (55%), Xbox (19%), Playstation (24%).
- How is growth? Organic, M&A?
- How is the market is operating within? Grows? Which countries operates in?
  - Video game market is expected to grow at a ~10% per year
  - Most of the sales are in USA and Europe
- Competitive advantage
- Risks
  - Financial risks is low as financial position is very strong.
  - Not achieving market success which is mitigated by diversification.
  - Dependency on key distributors like Valve (Steam), Apple, Google, Nintendo, Sony, Microsoft...
- Insiders & managers
  - Managers bonuses are insignificant compared to number of shares held by CEO Christopher Kostowski.
- How does it behave in crisis periods?
- Competitors & Comparables
- Why are the stocks cheap?

-NKbrXxenr0sqt2WRnDv.name: Water Intelligence
-NKbrXxenr0sqt2WRnDv.notes:
Data was picked from TIKR, Interest expense = expense - income.
In 2021 there was 1.87M of unusual items which is not included in the earnings.
Capex took from annual report, PPE + purchase of intangible.
-NKbrXxenr0sqt2WRnDv.summary:
Historically (last 5 years) has been listed at average 50 PER, 25 EV/EBITDA, but given upcoming recession

KPIs 2021:
- #1 ALD royalties grew 2% to 6.8M, network gross sales of 99M
- #2 Franchise related activities #3 US Corporate sales #4 International corporate sales -> grew 53% to 47.7M
- So all 4 KPIs combined grew 14% approximately to 147M.
-NKbrXxenr0sqt2WRnDv.thesis:
- What is the company's business?
ALD (American Leak Detection) pinpoint and repair water leaks without destruction
WII (Water Intelligence International) focuses on municipal solutions given the world-wide problem of failing
water infrastructure
- How does the company earn money?
Royalties from franchises + corporate services.
- How is growth? Organic, M&A?
- How is the market is operating within? Grows? Which countries operates in?
Water infrastructure expenditure in USA increases by 5%.

-NKt9CL9IBGI6pWiUb4m.guidance:
Outlook for FY2023, from Q2 2023:
Revenue guidance lowered from 275-285M to 250-260M
Adjusted EBITDA guidance lowered from 48-52M to 46-49M

Results from Q2 2023:
Revenue 62M, +17% YoY, -3% over Q1 2023.
Gross profit 42.8M, +12% YoY, -1% over Q1 2023.
Operating expense 44.26M, +13% YoY, 0% over Q1 2023.
Adjusted EBITDA 10.55M, +1% YoY, -2% over Q1 2023.
Explanation for results given is that customers became more sensitive to capex purchases given to headwinds affecting all companies.

- What is the company's business?

Most customers are midsize multi location business.
- How does the company earn money?
- How is growth? Organic, M&A?
Recurring revenue has gone from 25% in 2018 to 70% in 2022
- How is the market is operating within? Grows? Which countries operates in?
Operates in North and South America, western and central Europe, India and South East Asia and Australia.
Cloud communication platform market is expected to grow at a CAGR ~20-25% !!!

-NLzXC0osxFM2w3vQvK6.name: Titanium Transportation Group Inc
-NLzXC0osxFM2w3vQvK6.notes:
Fuel surcharge not taken into account for the calculations, not included in revenue.
From 2020:
Capex is net capex so acquisition - proceeds from disposition, can see negative values as most trucks are leased and eventually as part of the lease they become property of TTNM and then they are selling them.
Leases are net leases so repayment of leases (in financial cash flow) - proceeds from finance leases (leasing back of trucks to freelance drivers.

Revenue for 2023 was included as 400 because of potential recession.

According to conference call of 2022 Q3 earnings presentation, they will face a capex of 31M next year, so included in 2023, in 2024 reduced capex to ~1/4 of EBITDA (as average historically).
-NLzXC0osxFM2w3vQvK6.summary:
Historically TTNM has been listed at 9x EV/EBITDA, 23x PER
Competitors Fedex, UPS, JB Hunt are listed at average 10x LTM EV EBITDA,

The Logistics segment provides non-asset-based broker services, which include ancillary transportation services, such as third party logistics and freight forwarding services.
Truck transportation provides pickup and delivery

-NPvlc_eU_S2mmxEm1ml.name: RediShred Capital Corp
-NPvlc_eU_S2mmxEm1ml.notes: Since 2020 data picked from TIKR and corrected with annual report data.
-NPvlc_eU_S2mmxEm1ml.summary:
Sales growth of ~30% CAGR over the last 10 years, margin ebitda has been increasing to ~28%, and Net debt / EBITDA of 2x.
Historically listed at average 8,5 NTM EV/EBITDA.
-NPvlc_eU_S2mmxEm1ml.thesis:
- What is the company's business?
Shredding & destruction services and electronic waste disposal via franchise, corporate and corporate locations.
- How does the company earn money?
80% Shredding services
15% Sale of recycled paper
5% Royalties + Electronic waste services
- How is growth? Organic, M&A?
M&A:
- Proshred Philadelphia 2.8M revenue 2021, 32-37% EBITDA margin, cost of acquisition 7.3 - 8.4M -> bought at 7-8x EBITDA
- AMERICAN SECURITY SHREDDING CORP revenue 4.1M 2020, 4.6M 2021 EBITDA 32-35% -> ~1.35M 2020, ~1.51M 2021, cost of acquisition 5.15M on closing and 3.4M potential extra earnout -> 2021 ~3.8-6.3x EBITDA, 2022 ~3.4-5.7x EBITDA
- How is the market is operating within? Grows? Which countries operates in?
The market is about 3.6B USD / year, very fragmented with many independents and only a handful of large providers.
US Paper shredding market was valuated at 1.7B at 2018 and expect to grow at 7.8% CAGR from 2019 to 2025.
- ROE & ROIC

  - Competitors:
    - Iron Mountain
    - Shred it America
